results.title: Carry on abroad: or, what a package: or, it's all in: or, Swiss hols in the snow
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
The 23rd “Carry on” film finds a gang of prim and proper British tourists on a disastrous holiday. This is despite the reassuring name of the tour organisers and their location - Wundatours on a package tour of the Paradise island of Elsbels on the Costa Plonka. Their dreams of a luxury hotel quickly disintegrate when they discover the hotel is still being built, there’s faulty wiring, a leaky roof, all staff look suspiciously alike and there’s a disgruntled cook. Add to this the usual carry on shenanigans surrounding beds and showers and we are in for a holiday like no other. Cast includes Sidney James, Kenneth Williams, Charles Hawtrey, Joan Sims, Bernard Bresslaw, Barbara Windsor, Kenneth Connor and Hattie Jacques.

results.title: Whole School Planning
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Institute of Educational Administration
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Case studies in effective schooling”.
Case studies in effective schooling presents first hand accounts of how individual schools have improved their effectiveness. The first episode, “Whole school planning” looks at planning as a manageable series of arrangements designed to involve all interested parties and to make the best use of limited resources. Deer Park Secondary College features in this case study.

results.title: Carry on doctor
results.creator_credit: Gerald Thomas, Peter Rogers and Rank Organisation Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Carry on”.
Britain’s favourite comedy team “carry on” as they only know how! “Carry on Doctor” looks at life in a country hospital when the patients revolt against the staff. Hattie Jacques is the fearsome Matron, Kenneth Williams the cold-hearted Doctor Tinkle, while Sid James as the malingerer Mr. Roper, takes a vacation in hospital. A madcap romp of bandages and stethescopes, Frankie Howard as Mr. Bigger hams it up while Charles Hawtrey gives an unforgettable performance as an expectant father suffering all the symptoms of pregnancy.

results.title: Buffy. Season 2. Part 2. Eps 13-22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Josh Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season two of Joss Whedon’s cult series saw the introduction of Vampires Spike (James Masterson) and Drusilla (Juliet Landau) (Ep. 3 School hard), this seasons resident ‘big-bads’. This was the year that Buffy the Vampire slayer’s popularity went from small cult following to full blown media event, gaining some of the highest ratings the show has ever had in the US. Season two also saw the introduction of the cool and mysterious Oz (Seth Green), who became a ‘Scooby gang’ regular and a potential love interest for Willow. Unfortunately, like everything else in Sunnydale High, gateway to the hellmouth, Oz has teen issues of the supernatural kind (Ep. 15, Phases). Love is also in the air for Zander (Nicholas Brendan) as he hooks up with the ‘cliquey’ Cordelia (Charisma Carpenter), an unlikely pairing which results in much bitchy repartee (Ep. 10, What’s my line, Part two). Aside from a new slayer unexpectedly arriving on the scene (Ep. 9, What’s my line, Part One), season two’s biggest surprise ended up being the transformation of Buffy’s `soulful’ boyfriend Angel (David Boreanaz) into the uber evil, Angelus (Ep. 13, Surprise and Ep. 14, Innocence). This causes the love struck Buffy much grief as she has to make some difficult and painful decisions (Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Meanwhile, Angelus makes it his personal mission to make the slayer’s life hell (Ep. 17, Passion), while joining forces with Spike and Drusilla as they attempt to awaken a demon that will suck the world into hell (Ep. 21, Becoming, Part one and Ep. 22, Becoming, Part two). Cast includes: Sarah Michele Gellar, Alyson Hannigan, Nicholas Brendan, Anthony Stewart Head.

results.title: Buffy the vampire slayer
results.creator_credit: Gareth Davies and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: For as long as there has been vampires, there’s been the slayer - one girl, hand picked out of the entire world as championing the cause against the creatures of the night. Join Buffy, Giles, Willow, Zander, Cordelia and Angel as they struggle to keep Sunnydale - town at the hellmouth, free from all that is evil, while still mainaining a killer sense of humour and a savvy sense of fashion.

results.title: Buffy. Season 6. Part 2. Eps 12-22 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Joss Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Buffy the vampire slayer”.
Season six of Joss Whedon’s cult series is predominately the bleakest one of them all. The ‘Scooby gang’ are all in the throes of relationship hell. Willow (Alyson Hannigan) and Tara’s (Amber Benson) love for each other begins to erode as Willow falls deeper into the black arts (addiction metaphors abound in this season), while Xander (Nicholas Brendon) and Anya (Emma Caulfield) experience pre-wedding jitters with catastrophic consequences (Hell’s bells Eps. 116). Not to mention the fact that Buffy, the vampire slayer, starts this season dead and buried (Bargaining 1&2 Eps. 101 & 102). Considering how downbeat this season is, surprisingly it’s the one with the most light and comical villains, the nerdy three, Jonathan, Andrew and Warren (Flooded Eps. 104) - not to mention that they are mere mortals. It’s also the season that Buffy went musical (Once more with feeling Eps. 107), a Joss Whedon directed episode that proves once and for all how inventive and original this show can be. Buffy’s resurrection (you didn’t think she was going to stay dead did you!) proves to be the season’s overriding story arch as she grapples with being flesh once again and the dire consequences that entails. One of them being a destructive and highly sexual relationship with resident bad boy vampire, Spike (James Marsters).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joss Whedon and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation

Willow (Alyson Hannigan) and Tara’s (Amber Benson) love for each other begins to erode as Willow falls deeper into the black arts (addiction metaphors abound in this season), while Xander (Nicholas Brendon) and Anya (Emma Caulfield) experience pre-wedding jitters with catastrophic consequences (Hell’s bells Eps. 116). Not to mention the fact that Buffy, the vampire slayer, starts this season dead and buried (Bargaining 1&2 Eps. 101 & 102). Considering how downbeat this season is, surprisingly it’s the one with the most light and comical villains, the nerdy three, Jonathan, Andrew and Warren (Flooded Eps. 104) - not to mention that they are mere mortals. It’s also the season that Buffy went musical (Once more with feeling Eps. 107), a Joss Whedon directed episode that proves once and for all how inventive and original this show can be. Buffy’s resurrection (you didn’t think she was going to stay dead did you!) proves to be the season’s overriding story arch as she grapples with being flesh once again and the dire consequences that entails. One of them being a destructive and highly sexual relationship with resident bad boy vampire, Spike (James Marsters).

Not to mention the fact that Buffy, the vampire slayer, starts this season dead and buried (Bargaining 1&2 Eps. 101 & 102). Considering how downbeat this season is, surprisingly it’s the one with the most light and comical villains, the nerdy three, Jonathan, Andrew and Warren (Flooded Eps. 104) - not to mention that they are mere mortals. It’s also the season that Buffy went musical (Once more with feeling Eps. 107), a Joss Whedon directed episode that proves once and for all how inventive and original this show can be. Buffy’s resurrection (you didn’t think she was going to stay dead did you!) proves to be the season’s overriding story arch as she grapples with being flesh once again and the dire consequences that entails. One of them being a destructive and highly sexual relationship with resident bad boy vampire, Spike (James Marsters).

results.title: Post operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Describes how to make an anaesthetic bed and how to put a patient in bed after an operation with minimal movement. Describes how a patient must be watched and every reaction noted while regaining consciousness.

results.title: Pre-operative care
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Care of the sick and injured”.
Demonstrates the method of preparing a patient both mentally and physically for an appendectomy operation. Shows the method of preparing the operative field for abdominal or bone operations.
